vectorData.altText: What hormone are these cells responsible for producing?
That's right!  Leydig cells produce testosterone.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.

This histological image depicts a cluster of Interstitial (Leydig) cells adjacent to the seminiferous tubules.

Seminiferous Tubules (ST): Location of sperm production (will be discussed in more detail)

Interstitial (Leydig) Cells (IC): Found within the loose CT between the ST, secrete testosterone
